task.title: Record Teams Meeting
task.shortdesc: One participant can record a Teams meeting at a time. When you start recording a meeting, everyone will be notified automatically. You can also turn on live transcriptions and view them during the meeting. A copy of the recorded meeting is saved to OneDrive for Business.

step.cmd: In your meeting control panel, select the ellipses icon labelled More actions.
Select the Record and transcribe button.

info.note: Live transcription begins automatically when recording a Teams meeting.

step.cmd: In your meeting controls, select More actions, Record and transcribe, then Start recording.

info.note: A recording of a Teams meeting won't capture more than four video streams at once, whiteboards, shared notes, content shared by apps, or videos embedded in PowerPoint presentations.

step.cmd: Select More actions from the meeting control panel.
Open the Record and transcribe menu.
Select More actions then Record and transcribe to open the meeting control panel.
Select one of the following options to end a recording.

choices.choice: "Stop recording stops the recording of the meeting and the live transcription.
Stop transcription stops the live transcription of the meeting but the recording will continue.

info.note: Depending on the type of Teams meeting, the recording will either be processed and saved in the organizer's OneDrive for Business or in the meeting chat conversation if meeting in a Teams channel.
